SEARCH
Package edu.ntnu.idi.idatt.services

Class CookbookMenuService

java.lang.Object
edu.ntnu.idi.idatt.services.CookbookMenuService
public class CookbookMenuService extends Object
A service class allowing for a user interface, like TextUserInterface, to interact with a Cookbook object.

Provides the following functionality:

  • Finding a recipe by name
  • Searching for recipes by ingredients
  • Adding a new recipe
  • Editing a recipe
  • Removing a recipe
  • Showing all recipes
Since:
0.2
Author:
WilliamHoltsdalen
See Also:

    • CookbookMenuService

  • Method Details

    • setCookbook

      private void setCookbook(Cookbook cookbook)
      Sets the cookbook object to use.
      Parameters:
      cookbook - the cookbook object to use
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided cookbook is null.

    • caseFindRecipeByName

      public void caseFindRecipeByName()
      Finds a recipe by name in the cookbook, and prints it to the console.

      The method prompts the user to enter the name of the recipe to find. If the recipe is found, the method prints the recipe to the console. If the recipe is not found, the method prints an error message.

    • caseSearchRecipesByIngredients

      public void caseSearchRecipesByIngredients()
      Searches for recipes by ingredients in the cookbook, and prints them to the console.

      The method prompts the user to enter the ingredients to search for (comma-separated). If no recipes are found with the provided ingredients, the method prints an error message. Otherwise, the method prints the recipes to the console.

    • caseAddNewRecipe

      public void caseAddNewRecipe()
      Adds a new recipe to the cookbook.

      The method prompts the user to enter the name, description, instructions, and number of servings of the recipe. After creating a recipe with these parameters, the user is asked to enter the ingredients for the recipe, allowing them to add multiple ingredients. If the user enters "no" when asked if they want to add another ingredient, the method finishes adding the ingredients to the newly created recipe. If a recipe with the same name already exists in the cookbook, the method prints an error message.

    • caseEditRecipe

      public void caseEditRecipe()
      Edits a recipe in the cookbook.

      The method prompts the user to enter the name of the recipe to edit. If the recipe is not found, the method prints an error message. If the recipe is found, the method prompts the user to choose an option to edit. The user can edit the name, description, instructions, and number of servings of the recipe. The user cna also choose to add or remove an ingredient, as well as edit the amount of an ingredient.

    • caseRemoveRecipe

      public void caseRemoveRecipe()
      Removes a recipe from the cookbook.

      The method prompts the user to enter the name of the recipe to remove. If the recipe is not found, the method prints an error message. Otherwise, the method removes the recipe from the cookbook.

    • caseShowAllRecipes

      public void caseShowAllRecipes()
      Shows all recipes in the cookbook, and prints them to the console.

      The method prints all recipes in the cookbook to the console. If there are no recipes in the cookbook, the method prints an error message.
